Vedant K. Naik

📜 About Me

Hello! I’m Vedant K. Naik, an Electrical Engineering student at Michigan State University, specializing in embedded systems, control theory, and power electronics. 🚀 With a keen interest in robotics and the automotive industry, I am driven by a desire to create impactful technology and continuously learn new things. 💡

I enjoy designing PCB layouts, programming microcontrollers, and solving complex challenges. My experience spans C and Python for automation projects, as well as data manipulation and machine learning using MATLAB and Simulink. Whether it’s developing drivers for Zynq-based products or automating network testing setups, I approach each project with curiosity and dedication. 🛠️

Join me on this journey as I explore the world of embedded systems, robotics, and automotive technology, aiming to make a meaningful contribution to the industry! 🌐 Feel free to connect with me on LinkedIn by clicking the LinkedIn cube to the left.

💼 Experience

Intrepid Control Systems, Troy, MI

Embedded Systems Intern

May 2024 - August 2024

  • 🛠️ Enhanced firmware for Zynq-based products by adding IMU (gyroscope and accelerometer) and DoIP support, and integrating GPS data reporting into the company's scripting engine, resolving 7+ firmware issues and porting 3+ drivers.
  • 🔧 Created an automated IxNetwork testing platform with RestPy API from Ixia, reducing human intervention from 120 minutes to 5-6 minutes, enabling automated generation of PDF and CSV reports.
  • 📈 Improved orientation reporting for 2+ Zynq-based products by integrating IMU functionalities, ensuring accurate and reliable data.
  • 🤝 Collaborated with a team of 7, independently resolving 10+ assigned tasks and contributing to the successful completion of 5+ major projects.

Smart Microsystems Lab (SML), MSU

Undergraduate Research Assistant (URA)

Aug 2023 - Present

  • 🌊 Developing advanced sensing and control techniques for various robotic systems, currently focusing on the 3D 3CA actuator and soft sensors project.
  • 📊 Modeling a non-linear sensor using Time Delayed Neural Network (TDNN), achieving a highly repeatable realtime results.
  • 🔍 Designed an 8-pressure sensor breakout board using Altium Designer for a pneumatic pressure setup, measuring negative and positive gauge pressures.

MSU Solar Car Racing Team

Electric Propulsion Lead

Aug 2022 - Present

  • 🚗 Leading the electric propulsion sub-team, focusing on motor and motor controller integration.
  • 🔌 Configured and interfaced the motor controller with the PMSM motor and telemetry system using CAN 2.0 communication protocol.
  • 🔧 Developing a fault prediction system with Recurrent Neural Network (RNN) for 5+ subsystems, aiming to create a comprehensive dataset to track the car zonally and improve diagnostics and reliability.

Facility for Rare Isotope Beam (FRIB), MSU

Student Technical Assistant I

Nov 2022 - May 2023

  • 💡 Developed a high-pressure experimental apparatus capable of withstanding pressures up to 275 psig for research related to next-generation liquid metal charge strippers.
  • 📈 Automated data analysis applications for conventional carbon charge strippers, reducing analysis time by 60% and enhancing productivity.
